newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: NZOG says Chervil-6 starts at 1,270 bpd.
newsitem.headline: NZOG says Chervil-6 starts at 1,270 bpd.

text.p: New Zealand Oil and Gas Ltd said on Wednesday the Chervil-6 well in the Carnarvon Basin offshore Western Australia had exceeded production expectations with an initial rate of 1,270 barrels per day (bpd).
In a statement to the New Zealand Stock Exchange finance manager Gordon Ward called the result "very positive" in the early phase of production.
"It is our intention to increase the production from the well after this initial phase of testing," he added.
NZOG has a 23 percent interest in the project with other stakeholders including Novus Petroleum with 40 percent. --Wellington newsroom +64 4 471 4273
